alert.note: Alert for Baboquivari Mountains including Kitt Peak; Tohono O'odham Nation including Sells; Tucson Metro Area including Tucson, Green Valley, Marana, Vail; Upper Santa Cruz River and Altar Valleys including Nogales (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 15 at 2:49PM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of south central Pima County through 330 PM MST... At 248 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 9 miles south of San Miguel to 8 miles east of Topawa to 7 miles east of Kitt Peak. Movement was west at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Sells, Three Points, Topawa, San Miguel, San Isidro, Kitt Peak, Ali Chukson, Vamori, Cowlic, Fresnal, Choulic, Newfield, Coldfields, Comobabi, South Comobabi, Santa Rosa Ranch, Fresnal Canyon, Artesia, Pan Tak and Hashan Chuchg. This includes the following highways... Route 86 between mile markers 111 and 143. Route 286 near mile marker 25, and between mile markers 29 and 40. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
